chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany Nicole Ojeda

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda appeared by video.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Brittany Nicole Ojeda.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Brittany Nicole Ojeda.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of Attorney Mallory R Davis  for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: City of West Allis police officer Tyler Gibson.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Case set for a preliminary hearing on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case rescheduled to 7/28/22 at 8:30 am. Parties notified via email.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJB (DOB 4/26/20)

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Brittany Nicole Ojeda in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
